content: maddy lou crochet c alli c o e w h t l pattern 4 very back loop half double_crochet series maddy lou crochet the calli cowl pattern introduction this is the fourth pattern in a series of patterns which utilizes the very back loop of half double_crochet which is one of my favorite crochet techniques that creates a knit-look this pattern is perfect for the fall weather it works up super fast uses just one skein of weight 6 yarn discussed on the next slide and is lightweight yet cozy m naming it after my partner calli who is the most thoughtful person i know and makes my life better every day i love you calli what you ll need tools 10 00 mm crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge scissors measuring tape yarn roughly 90 yards/80 meters of a super bulky weight 6 yarn one skein of my holy grail yarn wool ease thick and quick from lion brand will work perfectly the prints / metallics / stripes have slightly less yardage but still enough for this pattern and work up especially beautifully construction notes your starting chain of 50 chains should measure 27 inches go up or down a hook size until you ve reached the correct length with that being said you can certainly make your starting chain longer or shorter to customize the size and add or subtract row to achieve the fit you want note that the instructions here though are designed to give you just enough yarn to make this cowl using just one skein of wool ease thick and quick copyright information copyright @ madison hansen 2023 no part of this document may be reproduced or transmitted in any form by any means design if you have any questions or comments please reach out to madisonlouisehansen@gmail com page 1 maddy lou crochet the calli cowl stitch glossary and special stitches stitches used us terminology chain chain half_double_crochet half_double_crochet hdcvbl half_double_crochet very back loop scvbl single_crochet very back loop slip_stitch slip_stitch special stitches the hdcvbl and scvbl are worked the same as a normal half_double_crochet and single_crochet - the only difference is where the stitch is placed the yarn over in a half_double_crochet creates a third loop on the very back of the stitch look behind the top two loops of your half doubles and there you ll find the very back loop to work into it s a simple adjustment that creates gorgeous ribbing you may have already followed patterns that call for creating a stitch in the front loop only or back loop only the concept here is similar - except you re going to look even further behind what is typically considered the back loop and find another place to insert your hook on the very back
